chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
R: stack nat
y0: string
x0: string
v: list nat
u: list nat

Goal:
u / v el R -> u / v el P

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
P = [d; e] ++ R ++ [[#] / [#]] ++ map (fun a : nat => [a] / [a]) Sigma : list (list nat * list nat)
string = SR.string nat : Type
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
stack = fun X : Type => list (card X) : Type -> Type Arguments stack _%type_scope
PCP_facts.sym_word_l : forall (R : stack nat) (u v : list nat), u / v el R -> u <<= PCP_facts.sym R
PCP_facts.sym_word_R : forall (R : stack nat) (u v : list nat), u / v el R -> v <<= PCP_facts.sym R
sym_word_l : forall (R : Definitions.stack) (u v : Definitions.string), u / v el R -> u <<= sym R
sym_word_R : forall (R : Definitions.stack) (u v : Definitions.string), u / v el R -> v <<= sym R
do_rew : forall (R : Definitions.SRS) (x1 x2 x y : Definitions.string) (u v : SR.string nat), u / v el R -> x1 = x ++ u ++ y -> x2 = x ++ v ++ y -> rew R x1 x2
der_sing : forall (P : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X), x / y el P -> derivable P x y where ?X : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- Type]
Inductive rew (X : Type) (R : SRS X) : SR.string X -> SR.string X -> Prop := rewB : forall (x y : list X) (u v : SR.string X), u / v el R -> rew R (x ++ u ++ y) (x ++ v ++ y) Arguments rew {X}%type_scope Arguments rewB {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
rew_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : SRS X) (P : SR.string X -> SR.string X -> Prop), (forall (x y : list X) (u v : SR.string X), u / v el R -> P (x ++ u ++ y) (x ++ v ++ y)) -> forall s s0 : SR.string X, rew R s s0 -> P s s0
rew_sind : forall (X : Type) (R : SRS X) (P : SR.string X -> SR.string X -> SProp), (forall (x y : list X) (u v : SR.string X), u / v el R -> P (x ++ u ++ y) (x ++ v ++ y)) -> forall s s0 : SR.string X, rew R s s0 -> P s s0
der_cons : forall (P : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u0 v0 : PCP.string ?X), x / y el P -> derivable P u0 v0 -> derivable P (x ++ u0) (y ++ v0) where ?X : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- Type]
derivable_ind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : PCP.string X -> PCP.string X -> Prop), (forall x y : list X, x / y el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : PCP.string X), x / y el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : PCP.string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
derivable_sind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : PCP.string X -> PCP.string X -> SProp), (forall x y : list X, x / y el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : PCP.string X), x / y el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : PCP.string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_prod : forall (f1 : nat -> option ?X) (f2 : nat -> option ?Y), EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' ?X f1 -> EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' ?Y f2 -> EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' (?X * ?Y) (EnumerabilityFacts.prod_enum f1 f2) where ?X : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- Type] ?Y : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- Type]
itau1_app : forall A B : list nat, itau1 ?P (A ++ B) = itau1 ?P A ++ itau1 ?P B where ?X : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- Type] ?P : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- stack ?X]
itau2_app : forall A B : list nat, itau2 ?P (A ++ B) = itau2 ?P A ++ itau2 ?P B where ?X : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- Type] ?P : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- stack ?X]
rewB : forall (R0 : SRS ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u0 v0 : SR.string ?X), u0 / v0 el R0 -> rew R0 (x ++ u0 ++ y) (x ++ v0 ++ y) where ?X : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- Type]
ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_list : forall L : nat -> list ?X, ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' ?X L -> ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' (list ?X) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_list L) where ?X : [R : stack nat x0 : string y0 : string u : list nat v : list nat |- Type]
Inductive derivable (X : Type) (P : stack X) : PCP.string X -> PCP.string X -> Prop := der_sing : forall x y : list X, x / y el P -> derivable P x y | der_cons : forall (x y : list X) (u v : PCP.string X), x / y el P -> derivable P u v -> derivable P (x ++ u) (y ++ v) Arguments derivable {X}%type_scope Arguments der_sing {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments der_cons {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
ZMicromega.max_var_nformalae_correct : forall (l : list (EnvRing.Pol BinNums.Z * RingMicromega.Op1)) (p : EnvRing.Pol BinNums.Z) (o : RingMicromega.Op1) (v : BinNums.positive), p / o el l -> v el ZMicromega.vars BinNums.xH p -> BinPos.Pos.le v (ZMicromega.max_var_nformulae l)
ZMicromega.max_var_nformulae_correct_aux : forall (l : list (EnvRing.Pol BinNums.Z * RingMicromega.Op1)) (p : EnvRing.Pol BinNums.Z) (o : RingMicromega.Op1) (v : BinNums.positive), p / o el l -> v el ZMicromega.vars BinNums.xH p -> BinPos.Pos.le v (fold_left ZMicromega.F l BinNums.xH)
ZMicromega.max_var_correct : forall (p : EnvRing.Pol BinNums.Z) (j v : BinNums.positive), v el ZMicromega.vars j p -> BinPos.Pos.le v (ZMicromega.max_var j p)
P_inv : forall c : list nat * list nat, c el P -> c = d \/ c = e \/ c el R \/ c = [#] / [#] \/ (exists a : nat, a el Sigma /\ c = [a] / [a])
in_prod : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), x el l -> y el l' -> x / y el list_prod l l'
tau2_inv : forall (a : nat) (B : stack nat) (z : list nat), tau2 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list nat, y / (a :: x) el B
tau1_inv : forall (a : nat) (B : stack nat) (z : list nat), tau1 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list nat, (a :: x) / y el B
in_prod_aux : forall (A B : Type) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list B), y el l -> x / y el map (fun y0 : B => x / y0) l
elements_in_partition : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = l1 / l2 -> forall x : A, x el l < -> x el l1 \/ x el l2
ZMicromega.max_var_nformulae_mono_aux : forall (l : list (EnvRing.Pol BinNums.Z * RingMicromega.Op1)) (v acc : BinNums.positive), BinPos.Pos.le v acc -> BinPos.Pos.le v (fold_left ZMicromega.F l acc)
Relation_Operators.swapprod_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : A * A -> A * A -> SProp), (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x / y) p -> P (x / y) p) -> (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x / y) p -> P (y / x) p) -> forall p p0 : A * A, Relation_Operators.swapprod A R p p0 -> P p p0
Relation_Operators.swapprod_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : A * A -> A * A -> Prop), (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x / y) p -> P (x / y) p) -> (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x / y) p -> P (y / x) p) -> forall p p0 : A * A, Relation_Operators.swapprod A R p p0 -> P p p0
PCP_facts.sym = fix sym (R : stack nat) : list nat := match R with | [] => [] | x / y :: R0 => x ++ y ++ sym R0 end : stack nat -> list nat
Inductive swapprod (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) : A * A -> A * A -> Prop := sp_noswap : forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x / y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (x / y) p | sp_swap : forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x / y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (y / x) p Arguments Relation_Operators.swapprod _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.sp_noswap _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.sp_swap _%type_scope _%function_scope
in_combine_r : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), x / y el combine l l' -> y el l'
in_combine_l : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), x / y el combine l l' -> x el l
in_prod_iff : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), x / y el list_prod l l' < -> x el l /\ y el l'
L_PCP = fix L_PCP (n : nat) : list (PCP_facts.BSRS * (PCP.string bool * PCP.string bool)) := match n with | 0 => [] | S n0 => L_PCP n0 ++ map (fun '(C / x / y) => C / (x / y)) (filter (fun '(C / x / y) => Dec (x / y el C)) (list_prod (list_prod (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_T n0) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_T n0)) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_T n0))) ++ map (fun '(C / (u / v) / x / y) => C / ((x ++ u) / (y ++ v))) (filter (fun '(C / (_ / _) / x / y) => Dec (x / y el C)) (list_prod (list_prod (L_PCP n0) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_T n0)) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_T n0))) end : nat -> list (PCP_facts.BSRS * (PCP.string bool *...
MPCP = fun '(x / y / P) => exists A : stack nat, A <<= x / y :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card nat * stack nat -> Prop
MPCPb = fun '(x / y / P) => exists A : stack bool, A <<= x / y :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card bool * stack bool -> Prop
iPCPb = fun P : stack bool => exists A : list nat, (forall a : nat, a el A -> a < | P |) /\ A <> [] /\ itau1 P A = itau2 P A : stack bool -> Prop
RingMicromega.eval_op1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> RingMicromega.Op1 -> R -> Prop
